title: Gobernanza y cumplimiento de la identidad

content.headline: OCTUBRE 2022
content.subheadline: CISO criminally charged por cover-up de breach 57M records

content.headline: Cuando Breach Response Se Convierte en Criminal Case
content.body: 2016: Hackers roban 57M Uber rider/driver records v√≠a GitHub credential leak. CISO Joe Sullivan decide: 1) Pagar $100K a hackers como 'bug bounty', 2) NO notificar FTC (ongoing investigation), 3) Make hackers firmar NDA. 2022: Sullivan convicted de obstruction of justice + misprision of felony.

highlight_box.text: Lesson: Breach response tiene legal obligations. Cover-up > breach. GDPR 72h notification. US states breach laws. CISO personal criminal liability.

events.title: GitHub Credential Leak
events.description: Uber engineer commits AWS key a GitHub repo p√∫blico. Hackers scan GitHub, find key, access S3 bucket con 57M records.

events.title: Extortion Email
events.description: Hackers email Uber: 'We have your data. Pay us or we leak.' Attach sample de stolen data como proof.

events.title: Bug Bounty Cover-Up
events.description: Sullivan decide pagar $100K disfrazado como 'bug bounty'. Make hackers firmar NDA. NO report a regulators.

events.title: Conceal from FTC
events.description: FTC investigating Uber por prior breach. Sullivan NO disclose este nuevo breach durante investigation. Obstruction.

events.title: New CEO Discovers
events.description: Dara Khosrowshahi (new CEO) descubre cover-up. Immediately disclose publicly. Fire Sullivan.

events.title: Criminal Conviction
events.description: Joe Sullivan convicted: Obstruction of justice + Misprision of felony. Facing 5 years prison (sentenced 3 years probation).

content.scenario: Eres CISO. Hackers email: 'We have 50M user records from your S3 bucket. Pay $100K or we publish.' Adjuntan proof. Tu CEO pregunta: ¬øOpciones?

options.text: Pagar como 'bug bounty', make them firmar NDA, no reportar

consequence.title: Esto fue Uber
consequence.description: Sullivan convicted de federal crime. Obstruction of justice. 3 years probation. Career destroyed. Company fined $148M. Lesson: Cover-up peor que breach.

options.text: Immediately notify: Legal, regulators (72h), affected users. Involve FBI. Document todo

consequence.title: Legal Compliance
consequence.description: GDPR 72h. US state laws (CA, NY). FTC notification. Evitas obstruction charges. FBI investiga hackers. Transparency protects company long-term.

back.definition: GDPR (EU regulation) require breach notification a supervisory authority dentro de 72 horas de 'becoming aware' del breach.
what_to_report: Nature of breach (what data, how many records)
back.penalties: Up to ‚Ç¨20M o 4% global revenue, whichever is greater. Non-compliance = massive fines.
back.affected_users: Si 'high risk' a individuals, notify them directly sin undue delay.
back.uber_violation: Uber breached EU users, NO notific√≥ 72h. Cover-up dur√≥ 1 a√±o. Multa: ‚Ç¨1.2M por Italy DPA.

back.definition: US NO tiene federal breach law (propuesto pero not passed). All 50 states tienen own breach notification laws con diferentes requirements.
key_states: California (CCPA): Notify affected residents 'without unreasonable delay'
New York (SHIELD Act): Notify within 'most expedient time'
Massachusetts: Notify AG + residents within reasonable time
back.what_triggers: PII breach: SSN, license, financial, health data. Varies by state.
back.penalties: Varies: CA up to $7,500/victim. NY AG enforcement. Class action lawsuits.
back.uber_impact: Uber violated CA law (HQ en SF). Settlement: $148M to 50 states + DC.

back.definition: Data Protection Officer: GDPR-required role (if processing large scale sensitive data). Independent privacy expert dentro de company.
responsibilities: Advice on DPIAs (Data Protection Impact Assessments)
Contact point para supervisory authority y data subjects
back.independence: Must report to highest management. Cannot be fired por doing DPO duties. NO conflict of interest (can't also be CISO/CTO).
back.uber_lesson: Strong DPO hubiera challenged Sullivan's cover-up. Independent reporting line = check on security team.

back.definition: Pre-defined plan para handle breach. Who, what, when. Practice via tabletop exercises. Update annually.
key_components: Roles: Incident Commander, Legal, PR, IT, CISO
Notification process: Timeline, templates, approval workflow
Evidence preservation: Forensics, logs, chain of custody
back.legal_holds: DO NOT delete anything. Legal hold on all relevant data/communications. Spoliation = obstruction.
back.uber_failure: No formal plan. Sullivan made unilateral decision to cover-up. Legal/CEO not involved hasta 1 year later.

content.instruction: Match el regulation/law con su deadline:

scenarios.text: GDPR breach notification a supervisory authority
GDPR high-risk breach notification a individuals

back.definition: Impede/influence investigation, proceeding, o official action. Includes: destroy evidence, lie to investigators, tamper with witnesses.
back.uber_specifics: Sullivan obstructed FTC investigation. FTC investigating Uber por PRIOR breach. Sullivan NO disclosed este nuevo breach durante investigation = obstruction.
back.penalties: 18 USC ¬ß1505: Up to 5 years prison + fines. Applies even if underlying crime not charged.
other_examples: Martha Stewart: Lied to FBI (insider trading investigation)
back.lesson: Cover-up peor que crime. Always cooperate con investigators. Consult legal.

back.definition: Federal crime (18 USC ¬ß4): Conocer de felony + tomar steps para conceal it + NO reportar a authorities.
elements: Concealment: Affirmative act to hide it (not just silence)
No report: Failure to report to law enforcement
back.uber_application: Sullivan knew breach (felony: computer fraud). Paid hackers + NDA = concealment. NO reported FBI.
back.penalties: Up to 3 years prison. Rare charge pero Uber case revived it.
back.defense: NO legal duty to report crime (5th Amendment). BUT affirmative concealment = crime.

content.instruction: ¬øEs esta acci√≥n legal en breach response?

cards.scenario: Pagar hackers $100K como 'bug bounty' para evitar leak
Notify GDPR supervisory authority dentro de 72 horas
Delete forensic logs para 'clean up' despu√©s de breach
Involve FBI Cyber Division para investigate hackers
NO notify users porque 'damage control' - wait 6 months

back.definition: CISOs pueden ser personally liable (criminal + civil) por security failures, especialmente si negligence o cover-up.
criminal_exposure: Wire fraud (if misrepresent security to investors)
back.civil_exposure: Shareholder lawsuits (breach ‚Üí stock drop). D&O insurance covers pero NOT intentional misconduct.
back.sec_charges: SolarWinds CISO charged 2023 por misleading investors sobre security posture. First case charging CISO directly.
back.protection: Document risk discussions. Escalate to Board. Get D&O insurance. Consult legal before major decisions.

content.question: Key difference entre GDPR breach notification y US state laws?

options.text: GDPR tiene deadline espec√≠fico (72h), US laws dicen 'reasonable time'
GDPR solo aplica a EU citizens, US laws a all residents
US laws tienen penalties m√°s severos que GDPR

content.explanation: GDPR: 72 horas a supervisory authority (hard deadline). US states: 'without unreasonable delay' o 'most expedient time' (ambiguous). GDPR penalties son generalmente m√°s severos (up to 4% global revenue).

content.question: ¬øPor qu√© Joe Sullivan fue criminally convicted?

options.text: Obstruction of justice (cover-up durante FTC investigation) + misprision of felony

content.explanation: Sullivan convicted de: 1) Obstruction of justice (conceal breach durante ongoing FTC investigation), 2) Misprision of felony (knew crime, concealed it, didn't report). El pago fue PARTE del cover-up pero not itself the crime.

content.scenario: Descubres un breach. ¬øCu√°ndo notificas a los usuarios?

right_option.label: Verificado (72h GDPR)
consequences: ‚ùå Riesgo de filtraci√≥n antes del anuncio

content.explanation: No corras sin saber. Tienes 72 horas bajo GDPR para notificar a reguladores. Usa ese tiempo para confirmar el alcance y preparar un plan de comunicaci√≥n s√≥lido.

achievement.name: Compliance Guardian
achievement.description: Master breach notification laws & identity governance

key_takeaways: GDPR: 72h notification a supervisory authority. High-risk: notify users sin undue delay
US: All 50 states tienen breach laws. CA, NY most strict. 'Reasonable time' ambiguous
Cover-up > breach: Obstruction of justice + misprision = federal crimes
CISO personal liability: Criminal charges posible (Uber, SolarWinds cases)
Breach Response Plan: Pre-define roles, legal holds, notification templates
